page.title: 05HITCHIN PRIORY (1)
page.content: In the year 1317 Edward II granted a charter for the setting up of a{ {Carmelite}Priory in Hitchin which eventually grew on its present site just off Tilehouse St. From its beginnings the Priory grew to be a centre of worship and scholarship,but by the end of the 15th century the community was in financial difficulties. In 1534 following Henry VIII's break with Rome the Priory felt the axe of the resulting Dissolution. Stripped of its lead,bells,painted glass and other valuable articles,it was left in a state of partial ruin. Little now remains of the{Carmelite} Priory except for the thick walls and church arches in the cloisters. The Priory's revival began when Ralph Radcliffe,who had opened a school in the remaining buildings, purchased the site in 1548.
